item.description:
MSSF Supervisor John Roberts has identified several areas at the East Entrance where volunteer help will be greatly appreciated:

1.  Fix and stain guardrail along Alden Rd.
2.  Sweep roadway both sides Alden Rd.
3.  Clean Bike path and edge of path to the trail entrance.
4.  Mulch beds and refurbish garden plantings at the Friends MSSF Native Plant Garden.
5.  Rake grass around guardrail and garden areas.
6.  Fix center Island at Alden and Long Pond Rd.
7.  Backfill gravel parking lot at edge of Alden Rd.
8.  Scrape and paint gate and re-number.
9.  Set up a new DCR map box (Friends will provide the trail maps) to the Friends' Trail at the East Entrance. 
10. Best of all: DCR is providing a new large kiosk which will contain a MSSF map and information about the   Forest. Volunteers will landscape the area and paint the kiosk! 

The Friends of MSSF will provide breakfast for Early Birds. DCR will provide the tools, but you are welcome to bring your own. Don't forget gloves. Children 6+ are welcome. Optional "Friends Trail" walk after work.
item.how_to_find_us: East Entrance, Long Pond Road, Plymouth. Look for the MSSF work sign!
item.why: Volunteers across the state will be helping prepare their favorite parks for summer. At MSSF we have an exciting project lined up for improvements that will make the Forest more enjoyable to visitors for years to come!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Participate in Park Serve Day at Myles Standish State Forest
